data.title: Rename soft-wrapped back to soft-wrap
data.body:
I recently renamed `Editor::setSoftWrap` and `::getSoftWrap` to `::setSoftWrapped` and `::isSoftWrapped`. I also renamed the config setting and command to match, but we've decided that wasn't a good idea.

This PR renames the config setting back to `editor.softWrap` and the command back to `editor:toggle-soft-wrap`.

Fixes #3531

data.title: Atom crashes when a package's `deactivate` throws
data.body:
Steps to repro:
1. Add `throw Error("hammertime")` to a package's `deactivate` method
2. Open Atom, and that package
3. Press `ctrl-cmd-opt l` to reload the window
4. Atom should crash

I ran into this while working on AtomLinter, so if it doesn't repro on other packages it should work there. 

See https://github.com/AtomLinter/Linter/commit/2199d7f731531e2de6f56c406028eb76091ba1d7 for an 
example of fixing crashing code. (That previously nonexistent method was being called [here](https://github.com/AtomLinter/Linter/blob/2199d7f731531e2de6f56c406028eb76091ba1d7/lib/init.coffee#L56))

data.title: If Auto Indent is off, it should not insert a blank line
data.body:
Auto Indent off implies that we should input every character manually.
But now, if we write

```
a={}
```

Then type RETURN between "{" and "}", it will insert a blank line. That's inconsistent, because this line is not manually, but auto inserted.
I tested Sublime Text. As I expected, it doesn't insert a blank line when auto indent is off.

Now:

```
a={

}
```

Should be:

```
a={
}
```

data.title: Add option to disable "open devtools on error"
data.body:
Hi, I understand the need to open the devtools on errors, Atom is constantly being fixed and improved, and I agree that it should be the default behavior.

But for users like me who are trying to give this awesome editor a chance, when working on a project (not working on Atom itself), the behavior of the devtools to pop on every single error is very annoying. I am aware that packages might have problems and they need to be fixed (or disabled to stop the errors), but since I'm working on a project I don't have the time to do this. If things get critical I might debug and start disabling and debugging every single package installed, but if you keep popping that screen on my face every single time I'm gonna ditch Atom for a long time.

So, after my whining, I propose this:
At least there should be an option to disable it, probably accompanied by a warning like "procceed at your own risk, if Atom starts to misbehave, follow the debugging procedure described here >link<".

PS: I searched through the issues and didn't find a similar request, only bugs that referenced this behavior. So, in case this is a duplicate, sorry.

data.title: Wait for themes to load before measuring
data.body:
While profiling I noticed that `EditorComponent::onStylesheetsChanged` was called around **25 times**, as each theme stylesheet was loaded, taking a total **200-300 milliseconds**, when an editor was open at startup.

Now the component waits for the initial theme load to complete before measuring so it is only called once at startup and removes **200-300 millseconds** from startup time when an editor is open.

/cc @nathansobo and @benogle for :eyes:
